texts.text-2-3: Ministry of Education and Skills Development
texts.text-4-0: Every night the monkeys climb a tree to sleep in.
texts.text-4-1: They sleep on very long branches.
texts.text-4-2: There, no animal can get them.
texts.text-5-0: One night a mother leopard came to the monkeys’ tree.
texts.text-6-1: She climbed it very, very quietly.
texts.text-7-4: She did not want to wake Momo up.
texts.text-8-0: She came near Momo but the branch shook.
texts.text-8-2: Momo woke up and saw the leopard in front of him.
texts.text-9-0: Momo shouted and pointed at the leopard.
texts.text-9-1: The monkeys woke up and shouted.
texts.text-9-2: They threw sticks at the mother leopard.
texts.text-9-3: She jumped to the ground and ran into the forest.
texts.text-10-0: Next night mother leopard came with baby leopard.
texts.text-10-1: The baby leopard was small but it could climb the trees.
texts.text-11-0: The baby leopard climbed the tree.
texts.text-12-0: Momo was sleeping on a very long branch.
texts.text-12-1: The baby leopard saw him and went very quietly onto the branch.
texts.text-13-0: The branch was very, very long.
texts.text-13-1: The baby leopard came near Momo but the branch shook.
texts.text-13-2: It shook and it shook and it woke Momo up.
texts.text-14-0: Momo jumped onto a bigger branch.
texts.text-14-1: The baby leopard jumped but he could not get Momo.
texts.text-17-2: The leopards ran into the forest.
texts.text-17-3: They did not have a monkey for dinner that night.
texts.text-19-1:
“An education and enlightened society of GNH, built and
                    sustained on the
                    unique Bhutanese values of Tha Dam-Tsig Ley Gju-Drey.”

texts.aria-13-0-0: A monkey and a baby leopard are on a tree branch at night, under a starry sky.
texts.aria-14-0-0: A monkey watches as a leopard jumps towards it from a branch at night.

texts.sectioneli5-0-0: This story is about Momo and some leopards. In the picture, Momo is relaxing on a tree branch with a big smile under the night sky. An owl is sitting nearby, and a leopard is resting too. It looks like a nighttime adventure with friends in the jungle!
texts.sectioneli5-2-0: This page is from a book for young kids called 'Momo and the Leopards.' It’s for students in Class I (first grade) and was made by people in Bhutan who help with school and learning. It tells us who made the book and where it comes from.
texts.sectioneli5-4-0: Every night, the monkeys climb a tall tree to sleep on the branches. They choose these long branches because it's safe up there, and no other animals can reach and bother them while they sleep. The picture shows them sleeping happily in the tree under the stars.
texts.sectioneli5-5-0: Imagine you are reading a story where one night, a mommy leopard visits a tree with some monkeys sleeping on it. The monkeys are up high, hanging on branches, while the leopard is curious and looking up at the tree, maybe planning to say hello. It's like when someone new visits your playground, and you're watching to see what they'll do next!
texts.sectioneli5-6-0: In this story, a mother leopard is climbing up a big tree. She is being very, very sneaky and quiet, like when you try not to make any noise. The picture shows the leopard carefully climbing, just like the story says.
texts.sectioneli5-7-0: There's a little baby monkey named Momo asleep on a tree branch. Someone sees Momo and climbs up really quietly on the branch because they don't want to wake the sleeping monkey. The picture shows the moon and stars, with Momo gently resting on the branch.
texts.sectioneli5-8-0: In the story, Momo the monkey was sleeping on a branch. A big leopard came close, and the branch started to shake a lot. This woke up Momo, and when he opened his eyes, he saw the leopard right there in front of him!
texts.sectioneli5-9-0: Momo saw a leopard and got scared, so he shouted to warn the monkeys. This woke them up, and they shouted too. To scare the leopard away, the monkeys threw sticks at her. The leopard got scared and ran away into the forest, so everyone was safe again.
texts.sectioneli5-10-0: One night, a mommy leopard brought her little baby leopard with her. Even though the baby leopard was small, it was really good at climbing trees! In the picture, you can see them under the night sky together, looking happy and adventurous.
texts.sectioneli5-11-0: There was a baby leopard who decided to climb a big tree. It was very careful and moved super quietly. Up in the tree, all the monkeys were fast asleep, not hearing a thing! The picture shows the baby leopard climbing while the monkeys are sleeping peacefully.
texts.sectioneli5-12-0: Imagine Momo, a monkey, taking a nap high up on a tree branch under the night sky. Along comes a cute baby leopard who spots Momo and decides to carefully climb up the same tree branch without making a noise. They're both on the branch now, with stars twinkling above them.
texts.sectioneli5-13-0: There was a long, long tree branch. A baby leopard was near a monkey named Momo. When the baby leopard got close, the branch started to shake a lot! It shook so much that it woke up Momo. The story is about how the branch shaking surprised Momo.
texts.sectioneli5-14-0: In the story, there's a monkey named Momo who sees a sweet baby leopard trying to catch him. Momo is quick and smart, so he jumps up to a higher, bigger tree branch where the leopard can't reach him. The picture shows Momo safe on the branch, and the little leopard trying to reach but not catching him.
texts.sectioneli5-15-0: In this picture, there's a cute baby leopard falling from a tree! It's nighttime because you can see the stars and the moon in the sky. The baby leopard looks surprised as it's going down, surrounded by leaves. It's like a fun adventure for the leopard, just like when you play on a playground and go down a slide.
texts.sectioneli5-16-0: In the picture, a baby animal, like a little big cat, is falling onto its mommy while they're outside at night with the stars. It's like when you play and accidentally jump on your mom when she's resting. It's a sweet and fun moment between the baby and its mother.
texts.sectioneli5-17-0: The monkeys were sleeping on the tree branches, but then they woke up. They saw some leopards coming and got scared. So, the monkeys started yelling and throwing sticks at the leopards. The leopards got frightened and ran away into the forest, which meant the leopards couldn’t eat a monkey for dinner that night. The monkeys used teamwork and noises to keep safe!
texts.sectioneli5-19-0: The vision is like a dream for the future. It talks about making a smart and happy group of people by following special Bhutanese values. These are like rules or ideas that help everyone live well together.
texts.easyread-text-0-0: It is a story about Momo and some leopards.
texts.easyread-text-2-0: This story is about Momo and some leopards.
texts.easyread-text-2-1: This is the title of a book for first-grade students.
texts.easyread-text-2-2: This is a group that takes care of learning and teaching in schools.
texts.easyread-text-2-3: It is a government group that helps people learn and get new skills.
texts.easyread-text-2-4: The Royal Government of Bhutan is in charge of running Bhutan. They make rules and help the people.
texts.easyread-text-2-5: Thimphu is a city in Bhutan. It is the capital city.
texts.easyread-text-4-0: Monkeys go up a tree every night to sleep.
texts.easyread-text-4-1: They sleep on very long tree branches.
texts.easyread-text-4-2: The animals cannot reach them there.
texts.easyread-text-5-0: One night, a mother leopard went to the tree where the monkeys lived.
texts.easyread-text-6-0: Mother leopard went up the tree.
texts.easyread-text-7-0: A girl saw a young monkey.
texts.easyread-text-7-2: She got up onto the branch.
texts.easyread-text-8-0: She went close to Momo and the branch moved.
texts.easyread-text-8-2: Momo woke up and saw a big leopard standing in front of him.
texts.easyread-text-9-0: Momo yelled and showed the leopard.
texts.easyread-text-9-1: The monkeys woke up, then they shouted.
texts.easyread-text-9-2: The children threw sticks at the leopard mom.
texts.easyread-text-9-3: She jumped down and ran into the woods.
texts.easyread-text-10-0: The next night a mother leopard came with her baby leopard.
texts.easyread-text-10-1: The little baby leopard can climb trees.
texts.easyread-text-11-0: The little leopard went up the tree.
texts.easyread-text-12-0: Momo was napping on a long branch.
texts.easyread-text-12-1: The baby leopard quietly climbed onto the branch.
texts.easyread-text-13-1: The baby leopard went close to Momo, but the branch moved.
texts.easyread-text-13-2: Something shook a lot and it woke Momo up.
texts.easyread-text-14-0: Momo moved up to a bigger tree branch.
texts.easyread-text-14-1: The baby leopard tried to jump to catch Momo, but he missed.
texts.easyread-text-16-1: A baby needs its mother to care for it.
texts.easyread-text-17-2: The leopards went into the forest.
texts.easyread-text-17-3: They did not eat a monkey for dinner.
texts.easyread-text-19-0: Some people need help seeing and understanding things clearly. It can be hard to see things far away or up close. Doctors can check your eyes and help you see better if needed.
texts.easyread-text-19-1: Bhutan uses special values called Tha Dam-Tsig Ley Gju-Drey to create a happy and smart community.
